intro: Anthericum korrowalense, commonly known as the Korrowal lily, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Korrowal region of Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pale blue flowers. The plant has strap-like, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
